content: Perhaps we should remove "Collapse" altogether? (I didn't know what it did until I tried it just now)
If only there was a way to see how often people used it. :joy:

In all seriousness I have used it about 8 times in 8 years to suppress gifs. If you asked me how sad I would be to see it go, we would have to have a deep philosophical discussion about sadness and the human condition and kitten gifs.
I have never actually collapsed a kitten gif, to be clear. Iâ€™m not a monster.

Steve Howell (showell) said:

If only there was a way to see how often people used it. :joy:

It'd be easy to check how many messages have the flag set, except we haven't added an index on that field, so it'd take a long time for the query to return.
Collapse has been there since ~2013, and I've seen very little feedback or detailed thought on it since then. But it may very well still be useful.
@Wesley Aptekar-Cassels moved this to a new topic.
I'd be in favor of removing it and seeing if anyone complains, while retaining the - shortcut.

I note that doing so would violate our principle of aiming to expose features equally to mouse and keyboard users. I'd prefer to do the query to check before further discussion of eliminating that; removing features that it turns out a lot of people use is a classic unforced error.

I do agree it's the least generally useful item in that menu, and also that when you're at 5+ things in a menu, we should be thinking about removing items or reorganizing them.
Wow! I assumed this was a "this message is 'too large' so we'll show it collapsed, but you can toggle it" kind of setting - until that shortcut I didn't think to use it on arbitrary messages.
I think it will be more useful now that we have GIPHY. We should look at stats after the GIPHY integration was enabled.
(probably also with some burn-in time, since I imagine there's a ton of people playing with GIPHY when it first comes out)
That's true, although I think work in #frontend > disable GIFs is likely to have a bigger impact there.
In general, I don't think we have a story for how people are supposed to discover "Collapse", and I think if we want it to be worth its space in that menu, we should have a story there.
There's a similar motivation, though, with "inline URL preview" embeds, which we don't have enabled in chat.zulip.org.
Heh, when that was (briefly) enabled in Recurse, I just wrote a adblock filter to remove them, I wouldn't have thought to use this.
